head.supplied: 12/4/96 ¶ ¶ Thinking over our pleasant conversation, honored Sir, it occurs to me, that it would also be recommendable to obtain from time to time some copies of the two parts of the "Key to the Syst...

div.p: No 475, unit 189, VPRS 805, inward and outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Thinking over our pleasant conversation, honored Sir, it occurs to me, that it would also be recommendable to obtain from time to time some copies of the two parts of the "Key to the System of Vict. Plants"
B86.04.05, B88.11.02. for your litterary interchanges.
See E. Armstrong to M, 27 April 1896 (in this edition as 96-04-27a). In this work is also my simplified and emended Candollean System.
See Maroske (2006). Besides it is the only extensive work, hitherto emanating anywhere, in which the dichotomous mode for characteristics is unbrokenly carried through from the commencement of the Orders to the end of the species. It is also quite original in several other respects in dealing systematically with nearly 2000 species of indigenous plants.
The Library Committee agreed on 28 May 1896 that copies of the work should be obtained, and on 8 September, 200 copies were requested.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
